resources.string:
\ Passdroid is an open source application that lets you store your passwords in a secure way on your \ Android device. The application use AES and SHA-256 to store the passwords on the device \ to prevent access without the master password.
\ 
\ http://passdroid.kodholken.com/
\ 
\ Copyright © 2009-2012 Magnus Eriksson <eriksson.mag@gmail.com>. All rights reserved.
\ 
\ Application icon by VisualPharm (http://www.visualpharm.com/).
\ 
\ This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify \ it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by \ the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or \ (at your option) any later version.
\ 
\ This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, \ but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of \ MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the \ GNU General Public License for more details.
\ 
\ You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License \ along with this program. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.\
Before continuing you need to choose a master password \ that will protect the information that is stored on the device. If this password is forgotten \ the passwords stored are not recoverable.
Enter the password you want to use:
"The passwords you entered did not match. Please try again."
Press the menu button and choose Add Password to create new password entries.
Database successfully exported to %s. Note that the passwords are NOT ENCRYPTED.

\ This will export the password database to a file on your phone or SD card. \ In combination with the import function this can be used to move the \ password database between Passdroid devices or as a way to back up your data. \ If you export the file unencrypted make sure it is \ removed from the phone as quickly as possible since other applications will \ be able to read it.
\ This will import a database of passwords that has been exported from Passdroid. \ The import will remove any existing passwords on this device.
\ Import not available. To enable it transfer your exported password file to the device\'s external storage. Make sure that the file is named passdroid_db.xml.
The file could not be decrypted using the current master password. Please enter the master password that was in use when you exported the password database.
